title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ATLANTA – On a night when points were a precious commodity, Dikembe Mutombo authored a defensive masterpiece for the ages. The Atlanta Hawks’ center didn’t just dominate the paint; he commandeered it, swatting a staggering 12 shots to propel his team to a 102-89 victory over the Golden State Warriors.

The game was a grind, a defensive struggle emblematic of the era, but Mutombo transformed the Hawks’ key into his personal fortress. Each of his dozen rejections was a seismic event, demoralizing the Warriors’ attack and fueling the Atlanta fast break. His intimidating presence was the cornerstone of the entire contest, setting a tone that Golden State simply could not overcome.

While Mutombo patrolled the rim, Steve Smith provided the offensive punch, leading all scorers with 25 points. Mookie Blaylock orchestrated the effort with a near triple-double of 18 points, 11 assists, and 8 rebounds. For the Warriors, they had no answer for the Hawks' defensive anchor. Latrell Sprewell managed 22 points, but his drives were consistently met with the outstretched arms of the NBA’s premier shot-blocker.

Ultimately, this was the Dikembe Mutombo Show. His 12-block performance was not merely a statistical anomaly; it was a historic, game-defining force. On this night, every Warrior drive was a question, and Mutombo, wagging his finger, had the emphatic, resounding answer.
